RAW.SOURCE:
` *---------------------------------------------------------------------* * Report YGPL_DBA_INDEXES_CHECK *---------------------------------------------------------------------*
REPORT ygpl_dba_indexes_check LINE-SIZE 256.
TABLES: tadir, tdevc. TYPE-POOLS: abap, icon.
SELECT-OPTIONS: s_srcs FOR tadir-srcsystem DEFAULT sy-sysid, s_soft FOR tdevc-dlvunit, s_name FOR tadir-obj_name, s_pack FOR tadir-devclass. PARAMETERS: p_ext TYPE abap_bool AS CHECKBOX DEFAULT abap_true. SELECT-OPTIONS: s_author FOR tadir-author DEFAULT sy-uname.
PARAMETERS: p_size TYPE ygpl_dba_table_size.
DATA o_obj_size TYPE ygpl_dba_interfaces=>ti_object_size.
INITIALIZATION. PERFORM set_default_object_size IN PROGRAM ygpl_dba_cockpit CHANGING p_size o_obj_size.
START-OF-SELECTION. DATA o_list TYPE ygpl_dba_interfaces=>ti_table_list. DATA o_check TYPE ygpl_dba_interfaces=>ti_check_indexes.
PERFORM create_list IN PROGRAM ygpl_dba_cockpit USING s_srcs[] s_soft[] s_name[] s_pack[] s_author[] p_ext p_size CHANGING o_list.
o_check = ygpl_dba_factories=>create_check_indexes( ). o_check->set_list( o_list ). o_check->do_check( ).
PERFORM display_result USING o_check.
END-OF-SELECTION. *&---------------------------------------------------------------------* *& Form DISPLAY_RESULT *&---------------------------------------------------------------------* form DISPLAY_RESULT using o_check TYPE ygpl_dba_interfaces=>ti_check_indexes. DATA no_need_just_for_use_case_link TYPE YGPL_DBA_INDEXES_CHECK_RESULT. DATA t_data TYPE ygplidba_check_indexes=>tt_indexes_check_log. t_data = o_check->check_log. sort t_data by namespace appl_component devclass tabname indexname. CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY' EXPORTING * I_INTERFACE_CHECK = ' ' * I_BYPASSING_BUFFER = ' ' * I_BUFFER_ACTIVE = ' ' * I_CALLBACK_PROGRAM = ' ' * I_CALLBACK_PF_STATUS_SET = ' ' * I_CALLBACK_USER_COMMAND = ' ' * I_CALLBACK_TOP_OF_PAGE = ' ' * I_CALLBACK_HTML_TOP_OF_PAGE = ' ' * I_CALLBACK_HTML_END_OF_LIST = ' ' i_structure_name = 'YGPL_DBA_INDEXES_CHECK_RESULT' * I_BACKGROUND_ID = ' ' * I_GRID_TITLE = * I_GRID_SETTINGS = * IS_LAYOUT = * IT_FIELDCAT = * IT_EXCLUDING = * IT_SPECIAL_GROUPS = * IT_SORT = * IT_FILTER = * IS_SEL_HIDE = * I_DEFAULT = 'X' * I_SAVE = ' ' * IS_VARIANT = * IT_EVENTS = * IT_EVENT_EXIT = * IS_PRINT = * IS_REPREP_ID = * I_SCREEN_START_COLUMN = 0 * I_SCREEN_START_LINE = 0 * I_SCREEN_END_COLUMN = 0 * I_SCREEN_END_LINE = 0 * I_HTML_HEIGHT_TOP = 0 * I_HTML_HEIGHT_END = 0 * IT_ALV_GRAPHICS = * IT_HYPERLINK = * IT_ADD_FIELDCAT = * IT_EXCEPT_QINFO = * IR_SALV_FULLSCREEN_ADAPTER = * IMPORTING * E_EXIT_CAUSED_BY_CALLER = * ES_EXIT_CAUSED_BY_USER = TABLES t_outtab = t_data EXCEPTIONS program_error = 1 OTHERS = 2. IF sy-subrc <> 0. MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4. ENDIF.
endform. " DISPLAY_RESULT

ITEM.LONG_TXT: U1&PURPOSE& ASCheck that tables with a client field as part of the primary key also have this client field in every indexes of the table. U1&INTEGRATION& AS U1&PREREQUISITES& AS U1&FEATURES& AS U2&SELECTION& AS U2&STANDARD_VARIANTS& AS U2&OUTPUT& AS U1&ACTIVITIES& ASTables with a client field as part of the primary key should always have this client field in each index. Sometime this field is forgotten. This should not have a large impact on productive system with only one client (see transaction SCC4), but could have an important impact on system with 5 clients or more. ASTo prevent from having any trouble please fix the index => add the client flied in the index : B1If this index is a SAP one, please search for an existing SAP notes with corrections for this index and/or open an OSS message to ask for a SAP note with correction on this index. We suggested to do not make change yourself as a reparation request because this will cause small trouble on system upgrades B1If this index is a customer one, please fix this issue by add the client field. U1&EXAMPLE& AS

U1&PURPOSE& ASContrôle que les tables avec un mandant (faisant partie de la clé de table) ont bien la même zone mandant dans tout les indexes. U1&INTEGRATION& AS U1&PREREQUISITES& AS U1&FEATURES& AS U2&SELECTION& AS U2&STANDARD_VARIANTS& AS U2&OUTPUT& AS U1&ACTIVITIES& ASLes tables avec un mandant comme élément de leur clé primaire devrait toujours avoir cette zone mandant dans chaque index. Il arrive que ce champ soit oublié. Ceci n'a que peu d'impact sur les systèmes productif car généralement ils n'ont qu'un seul mandant (contrôlez avec la transaction SCC4), mais cela peut avoir un impact important sur les systèmes qui ont 5 mandants ou plus. ASPour éviter tout problème : Ajoutez le champ mandant manquant à l'index cité : B1Si cet index est un index SAP, recherchez une note existante SAP sur le sujet et/ou ouvrez un message OSS pour demandez une note avec la correction. Nous ne recommandons pas de faire les modifications vous même car l'index serait alors un index "réparé" qui ne pourrait plus être mis à jour par les montés de versions. B1Si cet index est un index client, corrigez-le en ajoutant le mandant comme premier champ. U1&EXAMPLE& AS

ITEM.ENTRY: Control Mandant-Table has only Mandant-Indexes V0.0
Controle table avec mandant ont que des indexes avec mandant V0.0
